nn.core

Class InputUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • nn.core.Unit
      • nn.core.InputUnit

  • public class InputUnit
extends Unit
    An InputUnit is a Unit whose output value can be changed after it is constructed, but which doesn't change during training.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double output 

      • Fields inherited from class nn.core.Unit

        incomingConnections, outgoingConnections

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputUnit() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getOutput()
      Return the output value of this Unit.
      void run()
      An InputUnit's output value does not depend on the values of its inputs, so this is a no-op.
      void setOutput(double value) 
      void update(double[] inputs, double output, double alpha)
      An InputUnit has no weights to update, so this is a no-op.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
